oai_dc:dc.dc:description: To Arrange For State Suffrage Convention, Made by Local League. The October meeting of the Knoxville Equal Suffrage league was held Saturday afternoon at the board of commerce. Mrs. L. C. French, state president, also president of the local league, conducted the meeting, which was very largely attended. The afternoon was devoted to plans for the Tennessee suffrage convention, which will be in session in this city October 28, 29 and 30. The sessions of the convention will be held in the Lyceum building. The following committees were appointed:— Miss Ada Fanz, general chairman of the committee on arrangements. Reception Committee—Miss Lucy Crozier, chairman. Homes Committee—Mrs. Emma Fanz Price. Ways and Means—Miss Sarah Rutherford. Entertainment. Fund and Information —Mrs. Margaret Mann Carson. Advertising—Mrs. Marion King Pur- nell. Press—Mrs. Annie Booth McKinney. Chairman for subscription to suffrage publications—Miss Delia Yoe and Miss Cora Rule. Decorations and Badges—Mrs. Joel Tyer. Luncheon Committee—Mrs. Sue Barton. In charge of the benefit card party —Mesdames L. C. French, J. H. Anderson, G. W. Denney and R. P. Oppen himer. There has been some discussion re cently as to the legality of Mrs. French's election to the office of state president, and at the meeting Saturday the local league passed resolutions endorsing Mrs. French's action at the time of her election, and declaring her to be legally the president of the state association. A called meeting of the league will be held about the middle of the month, to further perfect plans for the convention.
